verses.verse: And when Balaam<WH1109> saw<WH7200> that it pleased<WH5869> the Lord<WH3068> to bless<WH1288> Israel<WH3478>, he went<WH1980> not<WH6471>, as at other times, to seek<WH7125> for enchantments<WH5173>, but he set<WH7896> his face<WH6440> toward the wilderness<WH4057>.

And Balaam<WH1109> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and he saw<WH7200> Israel<WH3478> abiding<WH7931> in his tents according to their tribes<WH7626>; and the spirit<WH7307> of God came upon him<WH430>.
And he took up<WH5375> his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>, Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> has said<WH5002>, and the man<WH1397> whose eyes<WH5869> are open<WH8365> has said<WH5002>:

He has said<WH5002>, which heard<WH8085> the words<WH561> of God<WH410>, which saw<WH2372> the vision<WH4236> of the Almighty<WH7706>, falling<WH5307> into a trance<WH5869>, but having his eyes open<WH1540>:
How good<WH2895> are your tents<WH168>, O Jacob<WH3290>, and your tabernacles<WH4908>, O Israel<WH3478>!

As the valleys<WH5158> are they spread forth<WH5186>, as gardens<WH1593> by the river<WH5104>'s side, as the trees of lign<WH174> - aloes which the Lord<WH3068> has planted<WH5193>, and as cedar trees<WH730> beside the waters<WH4325>.

He shall pour<WH5140> the water<WH4325> out<WH5140> of his buckets<WH1805>, and his seed<WH2233> shall be in many<WH7227> waters<WH4325>, and his king<WH4428> shall be higher<WH7311> than Agag<WH90>, and his kingdom<WH4438> shall be exalted<WH5375>.

God<WH410> brought him forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>; he has as it were the strength<WH8443> of an unicorn<WH7214>: he shall eat up<WH398> the nations<WH1471> his enemies<WH6862>, and shall break<WH1633> their bones<WH6106>, and pierce<WH4272> them through with his arrows<WH2671>.

He couched<WH3766>, he lay down<WH7901> as a lion<WH738>, and as a great lion<WH3833>: who shall stir him up<WH6965>? Blessed<WH1288> is he that blesses<WH1288> you<WH779>, and cursed is he that curses you<WH779>.

And Balak<WH1111>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Balaam<WH1109>, and he struck<WH5606> his hands<WH3709> together<WH5606>: and Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> unto Balaam<WH1109>, I called<WH7121> you to curse<WH6895> my enemies<WH341>, and<WH1288>, behold, you have altogether blessed<WH1288> them these three<WH7969> times<WH6471>.

Therefore now flee<WH1272> you to your place<WH4725>: I thought<WH559> to promote<WH3513> you unto great<WH3513> honor<WH3513>; but<WH3068>, behold, the Lord has kept you back<WH4513> from honor<WH3519>.
And Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> unto Balak<WH1111>, Spoke<WH1696> I not also to your messengers<WH4397> which you sent<WH7971> unto me<WH559>, saying,

If Balak<WH1111> would give<WH5414> me his house<WH1004> full<WH4393> of silver<WH3701> and gold<WH2091>, I cannot<WH3201> go beyond<WH5674> the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068>, to do<WH6213> either good<WH2896> or bad<WH7451> of my own mind<WH3820>; but what the Lord<WH3068> says<WH1696>, that will I speak<WH1696>?

And now<WH1980>, behold, I go unto my people<WH5971>: come<WH3212> therefore<WH3289>, and I will advertise you what this people<WH5971> shall do<WH6213> to your people<WH5971> in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117>.
And he took up<WH5375> his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>, Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> has said<WH5002>, and the man<WH1397> whose eyes<WH5869> are open<WH8365> has said<WH5002>:

He has said<WH5002>, which heard<WH8085> the words<WH561> of God<WH410>, and knew<WH3045> the knowledge<WH1847> of the most High<WH5945>, which saw<WH2372> the vision<WH4236> of the Almighty<WH7706>, falling<WH5307> into a trance<WH5869>, but having his eyes open<WH1540>:

I shall see<WH7200> him<WH7789>, but not now: I shall behold him<WH7138>, but not near: there shall come<WH1869> a Star<WH3556> out of Jacob<WH3290>, and a Sceptre<WH7626> shall rise<WH6965> out of Israel<WH3478>, and shall strike<WH4272> the corners<WH6285> of Moab<WH4124>, and destroy<WH6979> all the sons<WH1121> of Sheth<WH8352>.
And Edom<WH123> shall be a possession<WH3424>, Seir<WH8165> also shall be a possession<WH3424> for his enemies<WH341>; and Israel<WH3478> shall do<WH6213> valiantly<WH2428>.
Out of Jacob<WH3290> shall come he that shall have dominion<WH7287>, and shall destroy<WH6> him that remains<WH8300> of the city<WH5892>.

And when he looked<WH7200> on Amalek<WH6002>, he took up<WH5375> his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>, Amalek<WH6002> was the first<WH7225> of the nations<WH1471>; but his latter<WH319> end shall be that he perish<WH8> for ever<WH5703>.

And he looked<WH7200> on the Kenites<WH7017>, and took up<WH5375> his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>, Strong<WH386> is your dwellingplace<WH4186>, and you set<WH7760> your nest<WH7064> in a rock<WH5553>.
Nevertheless the Kenite<WH7014> shall<WH518> be wasted<WH1197>, until Asshur<WH804> shall carry you away captive<WH7617>.
And he took up<WH5375> his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>, Alas<WH188>, who shall live<WH2421> when God<WH410> does this<WH7760>!

And ships<WH6716> shall come from the coast<WH3027> of Chittim<WH3794>, and shall afflict<WH6031> Asshur<WH804>, and shall afflict<WH6031> Eber<WH5677>, and he also shall perish<WH8> for ever<WH5703>.
And Balaam<WH1109> rose up<WH6965>, and went<WH3212> and returned<WH7725> to his place<WH4725>: and Balak<WH1111> also went<WH1980> his way<WH1870>.
